title: WP Nel
text:
Willem Petrus Nel (born 30 April 1986) is a <a href="Scottish%20people">Scottish</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%231.%20Prop">prop</a> for <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a> in the <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a> and represents <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> in international rugby. He previously played for <a href="Free%20State%20Cheetahs">Free State Cheetahs</a>, <a href="Western%20Province%20%28rugby%29">Western Province</a> and the <a href="Boland%20Cavaliers">Boland Cavaliers</a>.
Career in Scotland.
Nel joined Scottish Pro 12 side Edinburgh in July 2012.
After three years at <a href="Murrayfield%20Stadium">Murrayfield Stadium</a>, Nel became eligible to represent Scotland in June 2015, and claimed he would decline an invitation to represent his native <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Springboks</a> in order to do so. He made his international bow against <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a> during the 2015 summer Tests, and was subsequently named in the final 31-man squad for the <a href="2015%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2015 Rugby World Cup</a>.
He scored his first international try in the 39–16 World Cup match against the USA.
Nel played in all of Scotland's matches in the 2016 Six Nations but missed the 2016 Autumn Internationals and the entire 2017 Six Nations due to a neck injury.
In March 2017 it was announced that Nel had signed a three-year extension to his contract with Edinburgh.
Nel played in four (starting three) of Scotland's group matches at the <a href="2019%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2019 Rugby World Cup</a>.
